titleStmt.title: To CHARLES READECharles Reade (1814-84; Dictionary of National Biography), novelist and dramatist, best known for The Cloister and the Hearth (1861). His pamphlet, The Eighth Commandment, 1860, attacking literary piracy and advocating wider international copyright, aroused CD's strong sympathy. Reade greatly admired CD, whom he referred to as "my master" (C. L. Reade and Compton Reade, Charles Reade, Dramatist, Novelist, Journalist. A memoir, Compiled Chiefly from His Literary Remains [London: Chapman & Hall, 1887], II, 37). [1860-62]

body.p: I shall be hereThe All the Year Round office. on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, in next week. after tomorrow until Tuesday morning, I shall be at Gad's Hill

closer.salute:
Believe me always
Very faithfully Yours
